author: Colletta Orr
text:
Breast cancer fatigue can occur as a result of multiple factors, including:

the disease itself

the psychological impact of receiving a cancer diagnosis

side effects due to cancer treatments https://t.co/pDZZ7hk38Z

text: Most oncologists and surgeons will see only a handful of patients with inflammatory breast cancer during their entire careers. MD Anderson has one of the nation’s only inflammatory breast cancer clinics. #inflammatorybreastcancer

author: Colletta Orr
text: African Ancestry, High BMI Predictive of Worse Breast Cancer Outcomes https://t.co/88H3kZUCtJ

author: Colletta Orr
text: A lack of early detection or prevention strategies for ovarian cancer is a major cause of poor outcomes for patients, and most do not have a family history or inherited genetic risk, so there is a pressing need for the development of earlier detection methods. #ovariancancer

author: Colletta Orr
text: Knowing family history and seeking out genetic testing to identify mutations in genes such as #BRCA1 and #BRCA2 is one way to detect risk for this cancer early. #breastcancer #ovariancancer

author: Colletta Orr
text: Early detection of breast cancer is possible due in large part to screening methods. While ovarian cancer is not as common as other women’s cancers, a lack of early detection or prevention strategies is a major cause of poor outcomes for patients. #breastcancer #ovariancancer

author: Colletta Orr
text: Check on your friends. Someone is struggling.

author: Colletta Orr
text: Two major things that people can do to reduce their risk of ovarian cancer are stopping smoking and maintaining a healthy weight.

author: Colletta Orr
text: The risk of ovarian cancer increases with age and most women are diagnosed after the menopause. Not all but most.

author: Colletta Orr
text: If your symptoms come and go with your period, then it’s likely not a sign of ovarian cancer.

author: Colletta Orr
text: With ovarian cancer, the most common symptoms are abdominal swelling or bloating, pelvic or abdominal pain, reduced appetite or feeling full more quickly and the need to pass urine more frequently.

author: Colletta Orr
text: African American women are being deprived of maximum utilization of technologies that can improve breast cancer outcomes. This is the responsibility of oncology providers...

author: Colletta Orr
text: Black women have more aggressive breast cancer at a young age than other women, and they’re more likely to die at a young age from these cancers. But they don’t have the same opportunities for screening, genetic testing, treatment and clinical trial participation, experts say.

author: Colletta Orr
text: New Drug Combo Effective in Patients With Advanced Ovarian Cancer https://t.co/9HmsuTIkO6

author: Colletta Orr
text:
Ovarian cancer used to be called a “silent” killer. This is because the early symptoms of this cancer can be difficult to detect.

But #ovariancancer is not silent. Symptoms may occur in the early stages and either be ignored or believed to be related to something else.
